Class ClusterMembersData

java.lang.Object
gw.api.tools.ClusterMembersData
public class ClusterMembersData extends Object
Helper object for Cluster Members page.

    • getAllServers

      public List<ClusteredServer> getAllServers()
      Returns information about all servers (nodes with distinct serverIDs) forming the current cluster. Note that some servers may be currently stopped (or fell out of the cluster for some reason), in this case ClusteredServer.isInCluster() will return false.
      Returns:
      information about all servers forming the cluster.

    • getRunningServers

      public List<ClusteredServer> getRunningServers()
      Returns the list of members of the current cluster. This method uses the following algorithm:
      • Retrieve the list of members' addresses from the channel itself - this is the up to date state of the cluster from the server point of view
      • For each address: find the detailed information about this member in the database
      Returns:
      cluster member list .

    • getHistory

      public List<ClusterMemberData> getHistory(String serverId, int max)
      Returns latest history of runs for the given server id.
      Parameters:
      serverId - server id
      max - max size of the returned list
      Returns:
      list of runs sorted by date descendingly

    • getHistoryQuery

      public com.guidewire.pl.system.database.Query<ClusterMemberData> getHistoryQuery(String serverId)
      This method is created specially for ClusterMembers page to serve pageable server history list view.
      Parameters:
      serverId - server id
      Returns:
      query that is decorated by the LV to provide paging capabilities

    • downloadSummaryReport

      public void downloadSummaryReport(int maxHistoryRecords)
      Downloads clustering summary state report.
      Parameters:
      maxHistoryRecords - maximum number of "History of Runs" records for each server. If 0 or less "History of Runs" section will not be included in the report.

      public Set<String> getUnusedServerRoles()
      Returns set of roles which are not enabled on any server in the cluster.
      Returns:
      set of unused roles, never null
